text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to state that processing sensitive personal data is possible if it falls under one of the exceptions of Art. 9 of the GDPR. The candidate answer explicitly discusses the legal basis for processing health data (which is sensitive data under Art. 9) and lists several exceptions from Article 9(2) of the GDPR, including 'Explicit consent' (Art. 9(2)(a) is implied by the detailed section on explicit consent) and 'Public interest in the area of public health (Art. 9(2)(i) GDPR)' and 'Vital interests (Art. 9(2)(c))'. This directly addresses and satisfies the requirement of the criterion.", "criterion_id": "da699e98-14ef-4832-ab6f-e586bce8ec3c"}
